Text.val: Author: Stephan Huppertz
18.11.2014 SH SCR19336 PartC: Fixed bug calling BSF500-12 (wrong template was passed to BSF500-12)
09.10.2014 SH SCR19200 PartA: Added BSF500-4 (removed sending email in case of unknown file format); PartD: Added BSF504
26.09.2014 SH SCR19179 PartC: Added SCRH_FILETYPE = 15 handling (BSF500-14 is called)
02.07.2014 SH SCR18994 PartB: Added BSF513; PartC: Added BSF500-13 and BSF500-14; Job is now turned to MSGW if one of the file
move (copy/delete) I/O operations fails, only implemented for incoming files
21.11.2013 SH SCR18535 Part A: Added delay (GSET_QUANTITY (380)) after scanning directories for incoming files
25.04.2012 SH SCR17278 PartB: Changed test to start preparations to time() > SBUY_BSF500TIME - ADMN_TIMEDIFFERENCE
28.02.2012 JH SCR17149 PartA: Only handle filetype 2 files if no filetype 1 file was handled in this run
31.12.2012 SH SCR17086 PartB: Added test SBUY_BSF500TIME + ADMN_TIMEDIFFERENCE > time() to start preparations
16.01.2012 SH SCR17015 PartA: Added BSF500-1/2/3 sub modules and add Part D - Incoming messages
19.12.2011 SH SCR16980 Part B: Added test SCRH_DATE <= date()
21.11.2011 SH SCR16912 Added BSF500_FR
-- General initializations
... retrieve email addresses of operators, uses to send them emails in
case of errors in the SCF files for incoming messages or I/O operations
failed for outgoing messages
-- Get directories (70 = new, 71 = handled, 72 = error)
-- Get directory (27 = template directory for SCF outgoing messages)
-- Get directory (75 = temp)
-- Get directory (73 = new)
@In case of incoming files are handled and an I/O operation fails (move file to handled/error directory)
the job turns to MSGW to avoid handling of the one file twice
... send email to operator (optinal if email address is defined in table JOBE)
(job log is already update)

ExpSyntax.val: 'Move SCF file to the handled/error directory failed'

Text.val: .. in case of directory does not exists --> MSGW
-- Get files from directory (70) = new
-- All existing files in directory /NEW have to be handeld by BFS500
... wait a while (defined in GSET_QUANTITY as seconds, so must be multiplied with 10, delay() function has to be defined
with tenth of seconds
... check if file still exists in scanned directory (perhaps manually deleted while BSF400 was waiting, see above --> delay())

ExpSyntax.val: Trim (Str ({0,2},'9'))&' new incoming SCF files will be handled now'

Text.val: -- Check / extract subdirectory and prepare diff. directories for further use
-- Create directories if does not exist
... /Handled
... if create of new directorry failed --> MSGW
... /Error
... if create of new directorry failed --> MSGW
-- BSF500-1 Import SCF Buyer
... move file to \handled or \error directory
-- Only handle Filetype 2 files if no Filetype 1 file was handled in this run
-- BSF500-2 Import SCFSupplier
... move file to \handled or \error directory
-- BSF500-3 Import paid invoices
... move file to \handled or \error directory
-- BSF500-4 Import interest rates
-- Workaround to solve problem when file is read again after check proper file
... move file to \handled or \error directory
@ Task use direct access to XML file
-- Error: Copy operation failed
... and finally delete the current handled file if copy was successfull
-- Error: Delete operation failed
-- Check if SCRH is locked by updating SCRH_STATUS temporarely with 99999
... set SCRH_STATUS back to 1
-- Prepare directories
.. in case of non existing template BSF500 turns to MSGW, see for details GB544
-- BSF500-11 Traded invoices
-- BSF500-12 Payment instructions
-- BSF500-13 Payment instructions untraded invoices
-- BSF500-14 Reconciliation csv file Athena
... (no template required, BSF500-14 creates CSV files)
